definition: to regard as/to figure/to calculate/to compute

sentences.english: I've passed the tests of business skills for abacus and shorthand.
sentences.chinese: 我通过了珠算和速记的商业技能考试。

sentences.english: At Abacus our country has a long history.
sentences.chinese: 珠算在我国有着悠久的历史。

sentences.english: Learning abacus made my son more interested in math.
sentences.chinese: 学习珠算使我的儿子对数学更感兴趣。

sentences.english: Yes, we can start the abacus competition.
sentences.chinese: 都准备好了，现在可以开始珠算比赛。

sentences.english: An abacus provides concrete experiences for learning abstract concepts.
sentences.chinese: 珠算为学习抽象概念提供了具体经验。

sentences.english: They also learned to use the abacus.
Now the Ministry of Culture are hoping the abacus will be recognised on an international stage.
sentences.chinese: 现在，文化部希望珠算能够在国际上同样得到认可。

sentences.english: The skit demonstrates the three stages of abacus usage and teaches about changes in the history of computing.
sentences.chinese: 本剧以诙谐玩笑方式介绍珠算心算应用三阶段。

definition: four rules of arithmetic/addition, subtraction, multiplication and division
to do a sum in writing/written calculation
The Nine Chapters on the Mathematical Art
traditional Chinese musical notation using Chinese characters to represent musical notes
literature and language/(PRC) Chinese (as a school subject)

military skill or technique (in former times)/all kinds of martial art sports (some claiming spiritual development)/self-defense/tradition of choreographed fights from opera and film (recent usage)/also called kungfu 功夫/CL:種|种[zhong3]
International Mathematical Olympiad (IMO)/abbr. for 國際奧林匹克數學競賽|国际奥林匹克数学竞赛[Guo2 ji4 Ao4 lin2 pi3 ke4 Shu4 xue2 Jing4 sai4]
